The Director, Sales Operations & Enablement for Mammotome is responsible for the overall productivity and effectiveness of the North America Sales organization.

This position is part of the North America Sales & Service organization located in Cincinnati, Ohio and will be fully remote. At Mammotome, our passion is driving innovative technologies that create efficiencies, while never forgetting that at the heart of every breast cancer journey is a patient.

You will be a part of the NA Sales Leadership team and report to the Vice President, North American Sales, Global Service, & Commercial Marketing responsible for Counseling the VP Sales and influencing Sales Leadership in the implementation of objectives to drive growth, retention, engagement and sales productivity. If you thrive in a fast paced, high volume, multifunctional, leadership role and want to work to build a world-class Sales organization—read on.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to:

  • Analyzes and models data to make assumptions, draws conclusions, and make recommendations to leadership team including visual representation for management presentations.

  • Oversees Customer Service organization (order taking, processing, trouble shooting) responsible for 1000s of orders per year.

  • Oversees design and execution of high impact and effective sales training including clinical, selling, and management development including working closely with sales leadership, product management and Human Resources to define sales competencies and planning content for new product launches, national sales meetings, first and second level trainings.

  • Manages multiple aspects of the customer contract strategy and forecasting processes including DOA, T&C, pricing tiers adherence and exceptions, and coaching field sales team to align to strategy and achieve sales results.

  • Supervises and monitors the design, development, financial exposure and payouts of annual incentive plans and customer price realization, in partnership with Sales Leadership, Product Management, Sales, and Finance, for a multi-channel field sales organization.

  • Prioritizes investments in enabling technologies in support of sales organization productivity, growth, engagement and attrition.

  • Leads territory planning and salesforce alignment strategies to optimize field sales resources to increase sales productivity by using assessment tools and third-party consultants where appropriate.

The essential requirements of the job include:

  • Bachelor’s degree along with a minimum of 6 years of business experience required; preferably in sales management, revenue operations, contracting and/or sales compensation/quota design & development working with commercial teams to optimize sales channel effectiveness

  • Strong data and metric driven mentality with salesforce.com technical proficiency and experience in sales enablement tools including Excel tools and data management, SalesForce.com, PowerBi, and SAP

  • Financial acumen and understanding of elements of P&L to understand levers for driving revenue, avoiding cost, improving margin and deployment of sales compensation plans

  • Experience in developing and tracking sales pipeline and sales performance metrics

  • Experience with building followership, leading teams and championing projects, with an entrepreneurial and problem solving approach to building and scaling repeatable processes.

  • Ability to understand high-level sales strategies, translate them into system and process requirements, and drive execution with strong business impact

  • Proven track record of being able to plan, prioritize, & complete competing projects on time inclusive of problem solving throughout the projects.

It would be a plus if you also possess previous experience in:

  • Familiarity with healthcare industry, experience in Diagnostics, Medical Device or Pharmaceuticals preferred

Working at Cytiva means being at the forefront of providing new solutions to transform human health. Our incredible customers undertake life-saving activities ranging from fundamental biological research to developing innovative vaccines, new medicines, and cell and gene therapies.

At Cytiva you will be able to continuously improve yourself and us – working on challenges that truly matter with people who care for each other, our customers, and their patients. Do you thrive in Life Science Sales? Do you enjoy biotechnology and working with scientists to help advance discovery? This job is for you !

Molecular Devices has the opportunity to be the innovation partner that empowers scientists to fast-track research breakthroughs, leading to earlier diagnoses and safer drug treatments. We’re a leading life science solutions provider of high-performance bioanalytical measurement systems, software, and consumables. With Molecular Devices, you’ll grow your career with best-in-class teams in a culture of collaboration.

  • Bachelor’s Degree or advanced degree in Biology, Chemistry or similar Life Sciences discipline

Be part of something altogether life-changing!

Working at Cytiva in the Life Sciences industry means being at the forefront of providing new solutions to transform human health. Our incredible customers undertake life-saving activities ranging from fundamental biological research to developing innovative vaccines, new medicines, and cell and gene therapies.

At Cytiva you will be able to continuously improve yourself and us – working on challenges that truly matter with people that care for each other, our customers, and their patients. The Senior Director , Commerical Americas for Cytiva is responsible for leading and directing the region Opco sales organization to meet or exceed sales revenue, sales profitability, and budgetary objectives and achieve sustainable, profitable year-over-year growth. The role involves strategic planning, managing people, selling, and improving processes. This position collaborates across the organization to get results through influence. In addition, the leader contributes to the development of the functional and operational long-term strategy and develops annual business plans to ensure alignment.

This position is part of Genomic Medicine, Commercial located in the United States and will be fully remote. At Cytiva, our vision is, to advance future therapeutics from discovery to delivery.

What you’ll do:

  • Is responsible for all the USCAN revenue for GenMed Accounts and leads team to meet or exceed regional sales targets to ensure alignment and drive one strategy.
  • Build, manage and lead a high functioning sales team responsible for achieving or exceeding monthly, quarterly, and annual targets in direct sales regions.
  • Develops and executes strategic plans that align with the wider organization based on market knowledge. Drive the regional Genomic Win-the-Spec program to drive genomic OpCo products specified in customers’ early-stage drug development process.
  • Work with Operations, Customer Service, Supply Chain, and other teams in Cytiva to ensure complete execution of our sales strategies in the region (including orders, shipments, AR collections, contracts including renewals)
  • Using strong DBS skills, lead sales funnel reviews and ensure reporting of all business opportunities, solution concepts and strategies to management by using CRM/Salesforce and provide voice of customer including applications feedback to product development team.
  • The Leader will hire, train, and manage the Americas commercial team, creating trusted relationships, supporting their development.
  • Partner in Regional Commercial Council to prioritize OpCo priorities and partner across OpCos to have a streamlined approach to the customer. Member of Regional Commercial Council across Cytiva to represent OpCo priorities, partner across OpCos, identify a streamlined approach to the customer and address escalations/ways of working.

.

  • 10-15 years’ experience in a sales management position along with selling consultative complex services or solutions to healthcare providers/labs. Demonstrated leadership skills and track record of successfully leading technical, customer-facing commercial teams.
  • Bachelor’s degree in business, Technology, Engineering, Science or related discipline; MBA preferred.
  • Prior knowledge of genomic medicine approaches, biopharmaceutical manufacturing process flow, and GMP. Experience working with large biopharma organizations; launching and scaling new solutions offerings in an emerging market.
  • Proven ability to hire, develop, manage and retain leading sales professionals.
  • Strong financial acumen in delivering business results by overseeing budgeting, sales funnel management, financial planning, and reporting, with a solid track record of team exceeding targets and maintaining long term customer relationships.
  • At ease executing comprehensive sales strategy, identifying market needs and opportunities; can quickly pivot value proposition and sales models to accelerate growth in target markets.

Excellent analytical, organizational, and interpersonal skills, as well as the ability to interact and collaborate successfully across all levels and functional areas.
